sen.j: 世尊寺家（せそんじけ）は、藤原氏から出た氏族の一つ。
sen.e: Sesonji family was a clan derived from the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 藤原行成が晩年、母の里方の代明親王の邸宅だった桃園第(平安京一条の北、大宮の西、大内裏の北郊で現京都市上京区大宮通一条上ルの西方）に隠棲し、邸宅内に世尊寺を建立し、またその子孫が世尊寺家を名乗り、代々そこを住居としたためこの名を名乗る。
sen.e: This name was used because FUJIWARA no Yukinari, in his later years, lived in seclusion Toentei (north to Heiankyo Ichijo, west to Omiya, northern suburb of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices), west to the current Omiyadori Ichijo-agaru, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City) which was mansion of Imperial Prince Yoshiakira, who was a member of his mother's parents family) and established Seson-ji Temple in the mansion and his descendants called themselves Sesonji and lived there.

sen.j: 初代藤原行成から17代を数えるが、世尊寺の家名で知られるのは世尊寺行能以後とされる。
sen.e: It is said that, only after seventeen generations from the first family head FUJIWARA no Yukinari, the family became to be known with the family name of Sesonji since Yukiyoshi SESONJI.

From its establishment by FUJIWARA no Yukinari, the Sesonji family lasted 17 generations, but it was not until the generation of Yukiyoshi SESONJI that the family name of Sesonji became well known.

sen.e: By the death of Yukisue SESONJI, the seventeenth family head, the Sesonji family ceased to exist.
